name: Storytelling: Rounds Analytics Pipeline & BigQuery @ AppsFlyer

venue.name: Google Offices
venue.address_1: Electra Tower- 98 Yigal Alon St Tel Aviv

description:
To Kickoff our new community we’ll be raffling Chromecasts at the end of the meetup! :)

Schedule:

18:00 -18:30 - Mingling

18:30 -19:00 - Rounds Analytics Pipeline - Aviv Laufer @ Rounds

How do we collect analytics at Rounds. We have build a pipeline that starts at the user mobile device and flow via our collecting servers (written in golang) until in inserted into BigQuery and Elasticsearch cluster. We will share our experience and the journey that we have made until we reached our current system

Bio: Aviv Laufer - CTO @ Rounds

A passionate developer, designer, and manager of software with over 20 years of experience, Aviv codes and solves technical problems with a combination of strong creativity and powerful technical skill. He is experienced in project management (planning, procurement, manufacturing, and finance), independent development, and system designs, and has experience in the managing of both small and large teams (over 200 people). Prior to joining Rounds, Aviv held senior management positions at several hi-tech companies including TechFinancials, Comverse and Shopping.com. In his spare time, Aviv enjoys spending time with his family and ultrarunning.

19:00 - 19:30 - BigQuery @ AppsFlyer - Past, Present and Future usages - Nir Rubinstein @ AppsFlyer

The talk will tell the tale of how AppsFlyer started using BigQuery, in just two weeks, in order to solve a failing feature and how we scaled it's usage to store and serve millions of daily records. We'll also talk a bit about AppsFlyer's future roadmap and how we intend to integrate BigQuery into it.

Bio:

Nir is AppsFlyer's Chief Architect and first employee. As an avid technologist, he gets his thrills from exploring, experimenting and working with various programming languages and new frameworks. He has vast work experience dealing with agile distributed technology stacks in various startup companies, such as Xsights and WinBuyer.

19:30 - 20:00 - Q&A Session

name: Handling Scale on AWS & Kubernetes Microservices on GCP
description:
Like last time, we’ll be raffling a Chromecast at the end of the Meetup :)

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/B1dlLgmdRvY2kiNPOhQEBTsZ4az8BMiOaS9z8LCr_5LSS9y2II973iwdf2tjSvzlOOJ92pvVi8J96zqDorUzgtmXSQD8UGZUp4gieBusBGi4Sx0qpERxzU63cV8Sm0M2qQnWZ6Zh

18:00 -18:30 - Mingling

18:30 -19:15 - Handling Scale on AWS @ WalkMe

19:15 - 20:00 - Kubernetes as part of Microservices

20:00 - 20:45 - Q&A Session

Location: Kremenetzky 3, 1st floor, Tel-Aviv Yaffo.

(entrance from the corner of Walter Mozes 1)

Handling Scale on AWS @ WalkMe

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/VgJFWNwWlyoziNEwlr9EJDS48cT_ebw7fpkuA9JH24XrwlHYNSKtYhxTEVSmIOnGfNjVcpWglNrqNiA2ue_7kDy6e86qd5t42B5f8Y2s2zCnszSUqv2cMdc2Kxc2M_aL-u1dYgji

Abstract:

WalkMe runs on ~40 million unique end user browsers each month.

When you think about it, WalkMe's architecture must support all the traffic of every customer that joins.

All that without affecting customers' website performance and providing real time insights and analytics.

In this talk I will describe the challenges our business faces and how it is been solved using our current architecture.

I will also cover our deployment and monitoring processes using different AWS products.

Bio:

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/M939OC-8XqHsuh39XrZfZZlqZYj9PVKA2IFKNH5lfnOJMx1UxkrO5RRS43ZeHFL7ZBPivQo1TDg4rEnWAuYfRqxONt8F0ZjQRn-juozzU5Xvd18A8B3ywSl1tSmTEM5z3HQc8sHM

David Ilievsky was one of the first developers at WalkMe and is now an R&D Director in the company. David took a major part in growing what was basically a garage style R&D department, to a scaleable startup company, by establishing the entire Devops and WalkMe Labs teams

He currently runs 4 teams (QA, Automation, Devops and WalkMe Labs) and prides himself on being a deployment freak, enthusiastic about software/system architecture.

Kubernetes as part of Microservices

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Q_mk8t45pXteZwR-U__VzSUHN5RFrLT9_W5P1OAgD0pU3EgDO_eWoit3AiscAcojOVYacC7qJf1SNu9pgO3_tuR9e9s2IAxlgB0-E5ICs83XJjFlAY536d0DyWEOVK4fXIwFtYZn

Abstract:

As the server-side applications growing up and the demand for low-cost and fast reliable infrastructure for logical applications changed the view of software architecture.

A few companies came up with ideas to separate everything and “Microing” everything to small logical methods that not connected to each other by the same code but with a same communication pattern.

In this talk I will show how Google and Kubernetes doing magic with their Microservices architecture and how you as a startup or a freelancer can get the benefits from there.

Bio:

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/81GYSw1nmm5ecVfPYOeGJICLtPmgLFfoRdJtzwVQqyjWHXgHW2GVm06P62g7JC-rpakZQlN-RdJlJI0cHkH7rKerNi0nrgPR-kXA2upDmz9UrtEXXodSqscBruCQ1bvuU5kG7u5u

Daniel Chernenkov is the chief technology officer at RapidAPI.

As a CTO & VP of Engineering he is responsible for the development process of the software products produced by the company.

Daniel started his first adventure in the computer development area in young age, his first programming experience was with the Python language and MatLab.

Since then, he continued to learn about new and advanced technologies.

His passion is about code and new cutting edge experiences that can bring innovation to the impossible levels.

name: Scalable Realtime Microservices with Kubernetes and gRPC

venue.name: Google Offices - Floor 29 - Dodly
venue.address_1: Electra Tower - 98 Yigal Alon St, Tel Aviv-Yafo

description:
18:30 - 19:00 - Mingling
19:00 - 19:45 - Scalable Realtime Microservices with Containers and gRPC
19:45 - 20:15 - Q&A Session

Abstract:

Building, scalable real-time applications that can communicate with multiple platforms is a tricky proposition with many hard problems: device network performance, real-time bidirectional communication, scalable infrastructure, and distributed systems.

By leveraging open source libraries such as Docker, Kubernetes and gRPC, we can mitigate these issues to quickly build a scalable, real time experience.

During this talk, we will look at how gRPC can be used as a performant real-time communication framework that works across platforms and languages like Go, Node.js and Java. We combine this with Kubernetes’ ability to orchestrate containers at scale to handle all of these devices.

As soon as you have something online, on a meetup group, etc - let me know, I'll be sure to tweet it out, mention it on the Google Cloud Platform podcast, etc.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/ahG_xt3i43h8ePirhoQDzLKmEOc9cDdb0uxXxcEd1B7Co_X-0N_EWHO0OH3XmyOgB_cKCFfaLejDUI-zgc76Eb2Vx98HYfMl4-bUBbFwD_R4q3CiaLhO8mzcyGc3SUfJazLQbAu_

Bio:

Mark Mandel - Developer Advocate for Google Cloud Platform

Mark Mandel is a Developer Advocate for Google Cloud Platform and one half of the Google Cloud Platform Podcast. Hailing from Australia, Mark built his career developing backend systems for over 15 years and authoring and contributing to several widely adopted open source projects. When he’s not building infrastructure in the cloud, he’s constantly looking for new and interesting things he can do with Docker containers, playing with his dog and reading too much fantasy literature.

name: Painless global container management with Kubernetes

venue.name: Google Offices - Floor 29 - Dodly
venue.address_1: Electra Tower - 98 Yigal Alon St, Tel Aviv-Yafo

description:
18:30 - 19:00 - Mingling
19:00 - 19:45 - Painless global container management with Kubernetes
19:45 - 20:15 - Q&A Session

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/aw8bo70388dn_emPTGrCjmKHQ1OBYmqc3C_1YR_43My_t3VIR00-p7jMYO0_oFf0q4gStf7EaFniIXuP93VvPb5oV1ji5_9-_OoJ-bkQKnuGm0hoOT2DBcU3CJHJIDvvDoCCBPkF

Abstract:

How long does it take you to package an app and deploy it?  To staging?  Production?  A cloud?  Three clouds?

Kubernetes 1.0 was an MVP for running 12-factor apps in a single cluster. Now, 4 releases later, we've built on that foundation to support stateful, data-heavy applications, and to federate clusters together for global low latency, high availability apps. In short, we're letting you run like Google, whoever and wherever you are.  Come along to learn a little of the Kubernetes history, and see some of these new features first hand.

Bio:

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/xyT3joFxFtbP92cDrd9dopnWYEvJsiXVRop-kG57FrG0iey5BJvEIZdzrY0JEz-IB1umGpuIx5JUn3SSAjS66SXSyoUT03x8wd329A2pTiDMExPvPm2UgjpxnMtghf6kfN1MPeXw

Here is a picture of Craig outside his old house in New Zealand.

Craig helps make Google's compute platform available to you. He started his career as a systems administrator, and has worked in development, deployment, DevOps, consulting, advisory and management roles.
Craig earned his Computer Science degree at the University of Waikato in New Zealand, and has over 15 years industry experience across North America, EMEA and APAC.

Craig’s Twitter

Demos of ML products (e.g., Cloud NL API, Cloud Speech API, api.ai)

Bio:

Dan Aharon - Product Manager at Google, Cloud speech API and Google’s new bots platform - api.ai.

Pre Google Dan worked at McKinsey & Company as a consultant for High-Tech and software companies working on Go-To-Market strategy and Product road maps.

Dan was also one of the founders of Mckinsey’s IoT practice and co-authored McKinsey’s Global Institute report, The Internet of Things: Mapping the value beyond the hype.

Dan graduated from Columbia Business school with an MBA, and has a degree in Computer Science from the open university of Israel.

name: Scalable K8S Microservices & Next Generation Staging
description:
18:00 - 18:30 - Mingling

18:30 - 19:15 - Globally Scalable Microservices with Container Engine & Cloud Load Balancing - Vadim Solovey @ DoIT International

19:15 - 20:00 - Next Generation Staging - Noa & Ofer @ BigPanda

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/xVVoOjm-tXf_9-n2TjFc18QUjcoSvCwRM0Qd1EMrSKkYm5e76SWIX-lz0cqK89kR6wvv1IdOTO-qyYDH-T4mX5V6ZXDsVgzSCKXJVHY2zvJ18MRWDei2gj6IMcQawLy1atwL0RDbhttps://lh4.googleusercontent.com/qseBdDAKz9HCH5T9YCYYLixa5yCbcJARuzLsz2dr3DxOVNY225iOiU3LCcyNUU2eJwNtlMkxc1I0klE5n2NIqtNtFIHp6sZvLP5M8Dp1HWqOfKv4hYLaYJVKvgdnAKzKuGrHuH9g

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Jy3PaxisDnZ_hHl5LELsqVCnfoq-u6yrwq_Qk82LFFvlTFZ5uMVHIOZQPVSAMRGOchyVETVOhx9oFG0Hs3duMmtuvF2U0rpLHcurGvF5la7UFsWcPpapWHgZdaoRqKLj2xlXl1SG

Title:

Globally scalable microservices with Container Engine & Cloud Load Balancing

Abstract:

Running services in multiple regions comes with both benefits and complications. Benefits include higher availability and lower latency to global users. Complications, however, can mount, especially for hybrid and multi-cloud deployments that face considerable security and connectivity constraints. So you may settle for running your services in a single region or even a single zone. During this meetup, I will show you how Kubernetes and containers can make systems easier to manage and deploy. We will also take a closer look at Google Cloud's networking capabilities such as the global HTTPs Load Balancer and Cloud DNS services and shows you how to use these capabilities with Kubernetes to create a truly global service.

Bio:

Vadim is a founder and CTO of DoiT International - a developers founded cloud consultancy company providing professional services for startups. We help startups with migrating applications and data to cloud, developing cloud-native applications,  architecting, building and operating as well as advanced data analytics solutions.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/RXlmCaugoRWn0TvCiSOsSkCckxucwjzBCLtgfNLHyHR2xOa3RLflzdpRU1sFwoTr0vPIudFdS-YiFBsZO48A4xNJL8UmYVEMJGhME8V8hQy7xeFfP7j4yiox6GiSCNLCmZQ2lw4H

Title: Next Generation Staging

Abstract:

During 2016 BigPanda expanded it's engineering team by 300%. The rapid growth presented a new challenge to our development process. our old static staging environment no longer met our needs. We had to think about our next generation staging environment. We will talk about how we implemented and deployed a productized, on-demand staging provisioning system, while reducing costs and improving our engineering team throughput and happiness.

Bio:

Ofer Schrieber & Noa Kurman,

With 20 years combined experience, Noa and Ofer are the de-facto devops team of BigPanda. with a major coffee addiction (Noa) and good naming conventions (not Noa) they fight operation criminals in a fashionable (not Ofer) manner.

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/v2Zy3313Say0zicIkof0Tn0Fo9oZEitbzdxG8C0ibJy_2SlsvFeIGpCXTX_9ByTWUbjdLEDveUhGK9mXGCRBoOePbAYPaZ85aTv8aYLMgKb0hGBcMc6Dqp6XI7yQmpHTtRIsX-jXhttps://lh4.googleusercontent.com/mQ-RJ8AozPp1_0OzBYNkbzMZ_WUUHVknpcTpJYXGSaP8RI4a0t9qS8iDPdgQjPnCZUL3u1hYEroPVe0Nb695SVqtmefTfrtn6RH8v2ccK0QsqM0DyEXJ7hTYqC__uDaAGitn8wvG

name: TensorFlow in the Wild
description:
18:30 - 19:00 - Mingling

19:00 - 19:45 - TensorFlow in the Wild - Kaz Sato @ Google

19:45 - 20:15 - Q&A

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/KN9LbROxEjWSAXpBR8NQ1fdAsnIK_gcZNb7cREZzVJuDn4KR9sUJdWYkAXGQTKvxJq2rQX6v0iOfounKe-ciiJS_RJv1J3Sy1JGjIHaC22scVflStDrmOPIrf-YjDiuVfc2Dr2L0https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/RkGOJfWWyhHgCD-QwHbiBaqOjIYGCE2AZ79PnylBSUgnPtynMiv5Ijk46Ca5xWDjdekziUxxFT3o0Kba2Fp-4GMZ64GNuuHylmmM2NxTfrpjZzY-2wYWbhvNYH5ZzPQfxQfcWybw

Title: TensorFlow in the Wild

Abstract:

TensorFlow, the open source library for machine learning from Google, has been democratizing the world of machine intelligence since its launch in 2015. With TensorFlow, combined with the scalability of Google’s Cloud Machine Learning Engine, now anyone can leverage deep learning technology cheaply and without much expertise. We will explore three examples of business that have adopted TensorFlow and Cloud ML to solve their real-world problems: a cucumber farmer in Japan who was able to build a deep learning-based cucumber sorter by himself, a used car auction service using TF for classifying car models and parts, and a global insurance company that has been able to increase prediction accuracy significantly on accident cases.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/3GqpeES8qF9PkDibR17FAM_cKRKzcb3M-zFWZirRBeiBk8I4b_o69RjqIU_JgsReGoZzEep5s5ndyAQGzWR2cgUOO0VPteIwSuwLQ9DsmtX5fKS80z6znIm6eBdTgIItVeaT6pcF

Bio:

Kaz Sato is Staff Developer Advocate at Cloud Platform team, Google Inc. Focusing on Machine Learning and Data Analytics products, such as TensorFlow, Cloud ML and BigQuery. Invited to major events including Google Cloud Next '17 SF, Google I/O 2016 and 2017, Strata+Hadoop World London 2017, San Jose and NYC 2016, Hadoop Summit 2016, ODSC East 2016 and 2017. Kaz also has been leading and supporting developer communities for Google Cloud for over 8 years. He is also interested in hardwares and IoT, and has been hosting FPGA meetups since 2013.

name: Zen in the Cloud: 12 principles of getting your data ready for ML

venue.name: Google Offices - Floor 29 - Dodly
venue.address_1: Electra Tower - 98 Yigal Alon St, Tel Aviv-Yafo

description:
Valliappa (Lak) Lakshmanan, the author of "Data Science on the Google Cloud Platform" by O'reilly, will be sharing the 12 Principles for data preparation for ML & AI, followed by a short Demo & Intro to Google's ML tools and solutions, and an open Q&A session about the above and TensorFlow.

Bio:

Valliappa Lakshmanan - Big Data and ML Professional Services at Google

name: Google Cloud Security & Data Analytics

venue.name: Google Offices - Floor 29 - Dodly
venue.address_1: Electra Tower - 98 Yigal Alon St, Tel Aviv-Yafo

description:
18:00 - 18:30 - Mingling

18:30 - 19:15 - Google Cloud Security - Matthew O’Connor @ Google

19:15 - 20:00 - Intro to Data Analytics on Google Cloud Platform - Jonathan Yarkoni @ Google

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/8LiCF4d374Y_jfhvyrKk8SuhKQkIoJNyAGBo-387ibNgqoJD4b_SB2BAlCz8-ob0N09DQAJf_VnTpHnABpf5f8n89nkewx_7plQEE_cMVhyCnlqlH2URCwImwhf9XIU0QMwG6G0f

Title: Google Cloud Security

Abstract:

We’ll be talking about attractive subjects in the manner of security of Google Cloud Platform:

Security as a first principle

How Google does Security at Scale

Case study: How did GCP deal with the Meltdown and Spectre vulnerabilities

Bio:

Matthew O’Connor (https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthew-o-connor-12418/) is a Product Manager in the Cloud Office of the CTO based in Sunnyvale, CA. He specializes in Security, Compliance, Privacy, Policy, and large scale software services.

Prior to joining the Office of the CTO, Matthew was responsible for Security and Compliance products on Google Cloud Platform. He established the key foundations for Cloud Compliance Program and many of the early Cloud Platform security products. Matthew also built products for Google Enterprise, having joined Google via the acquisition of Postini in 2007.

Before Google, Matthew held product management and engineering roles building scaled services at Postini, Tellme Networks, AOL, Netscape, Inflow, and Hewlett-Packard. His career started as a US Air Force officer on the MILSTAR satellite program. Matthew has an executive MBA from the University of California and earned a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Engineering from Santa Clara University.

Title: Intro to Data Analytics on Google Cloud Platform

Abstract:
From collecting data to visualizing it, building great solutions requires you to know your tools. Getting value out of analytics is much more than just collecting different touchpoints. The important thing is what you can do with the data and how fast can you do it. In this session, we’ll cover everything from collecting and ingesting to analyzing and visualizing. By the end of this session, you’ll be familiar with the different data analytics products and how to best put them to use tomorrow.

Bio:
Jonathan Yarkoni is a Customer Engineer @Google Cloud. Previously he was an R&D Team Leader @Ironsource working on large scale products heavily relying on analytics. As a co-founder of two startups he has a passion for MVPs and data driven development.

name: "Starting Up" with Google Cloud 101
description:
The meetup with be conducted in Hebrew :)

18:00 - 18:30 - Mingling & Pizzas!!!
18:30 - 19:15 - Deploying a Startup - Google Cloud 101 - Demi Ben-Ari @ Panorays
19:15 - 20:00 - Start with Google Cloud - Naama Yanko @ Google

Title: Deploying a Startup - Google Cloud 101

Abstract:
All I wanted is to deploy and run my code, is that too much to request?

Today, no one actually wants the hustle of working on infrastructure, we all just want to have running code and create value for our customers and users.
In this talk we’ll describe how we can leverage the experience and strengths of Google Cloud Platform to easily develop and deploy our code, showing how Networking and Security is made easy with the cloud, what’s SQL and NoSQL and how the hell do it launch machines? showing all of the amazing tools that will make our lives really easy and make us a 100 times much more productive as developers.
Step by step “guide” of how to start your startup company from scratch to create immediate value!
Promise to share all of the stupid things too.

Bio:
Demi Ben-Ari, Co-Founder & VP R&D @ Panorays, Google Developers Expert.
Software engineer, Entrepreneur and an International Tech Speaker.
Has over 12 years of experience in building various systems both from the field of near real time applications and Big Data distributed systems.
Co-Founder of the “Big Things” Big Data community and Google Developer Group Cloud.
Big Data Expert, but interested in all kinds of technologies, from front-end to backend, whatever moves data around.

Title: Start with Google Cloud

Abstract:
The Google cloud Startup team in Israel, help startups in their first steps in the cloud. The startup team offers a number of programs designed to help startups in various stages: from idea stage to scale. In this talk, Naama Yanko, VC & Startup Business Development Manager, how to make first steps with Google cloud and how to apply the various programs.

Bio:
Naama leads VC & Startup Business Development for Google Cloud Platform in Israel and Africa and her focus is developing strong startup ecosystem around Google Cloud Platform. Before joining Google, Naama worked at Magma Venture Partners, a leading Israeli VC as Deal Flow & Marketing Manager. Prior to that she served as the Head of Deal Flow and Business Development at Deloitte. Naama holds MBA & BA in Political Science and International Relations, both from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

name: Yah ML- Intro to Google Cloud Machine Learning
description:
Google Cloud for startups is excited to host a meetup with Omer Mahmood, Google Cloud machine learning expert from London!

Register NOW: https://events.withgoogle.com/all-about-ml-community-event/

In this session Omer will provide an in depth look at Google Cloud machine learning tools, capabilities and how your startup can benefit from it. You will also have the chance to get your specific questions answered by Omer.

Agenda:
18:00-18:30 - Networking & Pizza

18:30-18:45 - Introduction to Google Cloud Startup programs, Naama Yanko - Startup Business Development Manager

18:45-20:00 - Introduction to Google Cloud Machine learning, Omer Mahmood - Sales Engineer, Google Cloud

We are also offering eligible developers and startups who join the event access to $3,000 in Cloud and Firebase credits**

The meetup will be conducted in English

**Cloud credits are available for eligible startups who have not previously received promotional Cloud credits and startups in early stages (up to Series A).

name: The Journey to Google Cloud with Uri Cusnir - MyPermissions
description:
Google Cloud for Startups are excited to host a cloud migration meetup with Uri Cusnir, VP R&D at MyPermissions.

Register now at:
https://events.withgoogle.com/mypermissions-google-cloud-for-startups/

Join us on Tuesday, December 11th as Uri walks us through MyPermissions journey of migrating to the Google Cloud Platform, the business and technical motives behind the decision and the associated costs.

MyPermissions (MyPrivacy) was founded in 2012 with a mission to cover a variety of privacy settings for the non-tech users in this fast changing digital environment.

Uri has worked in a variety of startups as CTO, CEO and Co-founder in the AdTech industry, where he focused on developing new techniques to help advertisers track and sell more of their products to potential customers. Today Uri is VP of R&D at MyPermissions

Additionally we are offering eligible developers and startups who join the event access to $3,000 in Cloud and Firebase credits**

Agenda:

18:00-18:30 - Networking & Pizza

18:30-18:45 - Introduction to Google Cloud Startup programs - Naama Yanko, Startup Business Development Manager

18:45-20:00 - Cloud Migration - Why, How, Pain & Things I’d do differently- Uri Cusnir, VP R&D at MyPermission

**Cloud credits are available for eligible startups who have not previously received promotional Cloud credits and startups in early stages (up to Series A).

name: Navigating your startup to an M&A - Founder & VC perspectives
description:
Fireside Chat hosted by State of Mind Ventures And Google Cloud!

Google Cloud For Startups & State of Mind Ventures are proud to invite you to an exclusive event for startup founders.

At this event we will be hosting Issy Ben-Shaul, the founder and CEO of Velostrata, a cloud migration company, recently acquired by Google. Joining Issy, will be Yuval Baharav, the general partner of SOMV.

Yuval and Issy, will hold an intimate fireside chat and discuss the different aspects startups need to keep in mind and actively pursue when navigating their company for an M&A event.

Agenda:
18:00-18:30 - Networking & Munchies
18:30-19:30 - Navigating your startup to an M&A - Founder & VC perspectives - Fireside chat with Issy Ben-Shaul, Director of Engineering of Google Cloud with Yuval Baharav, General Partner of SOMV
19:30-20:00 - Q&A

About SOMV:
State of Mind Ventures is an early stage venture capital fund. We are a focused fund. We invest in the people that are building the technology infrastructure for tomorrow. We partner early, earlier than most funds, with innovative teams of over-achievers, and we are there with them, as they shape their vision, build their teams and take on the world. So we believe our role is simple. It is to find and empower the founders of the future. We are interested in: Super-Scale, Very Big-Data, Deep AI, Computer Vision, Semi-conductors, Computer Vision, Disruptive Cyber, IOT, Communications, Storage, Aerospace and just World Changing Ideas.

About Google Cloud for Startups:
The Google Cloud Startup Program is designed to help startups build and scale using Google Cloud products and services.

name: Dive into the Google Cloud Machine Learning Spectrum
description:
Register NOW: https://events.withgoogle.com/dive-into-the-machine-learning-spectrum/

Google Cloud for Startups are excited to host Zack Akil, Developer Advocate from London for a machine learning meetup.

Join us on February 6th at Google Tel Aviv, 12th floor as we take a glance at what machine learning is capable of, along with demos of the tools and techniques to get started.

Meet our speaker:

Zack Akil is a developer advocate for Cloud Machine Learning at Google. When he’s not teaching machine learning at Google, he likes to teach machine learning at his hands-on data science meetup, Central London Data Science Project Nights. Although he works in the cloud, most of his hobby projects look at different ways you can embed machine learning into low-power devices like Raspberry Pis and Arduinos. He also likes to have a bit of banter with his mixed tag rugby teams.

*The meetup will be conducted in English.

Agenda:

18:30-19:00 - Networking & Munchies

19:00-20:00 - Dive into the Machine Learning spectrum

20:00-20:30 - Q&A

name: How to Use Terraform to Catapult Your Infrastructure Forward
description:
RSVP Required:
https://events.withgoogle.com/how-to-use-terraform-to-catapult-your-infrastructure-forward/

Managing your cloud infrastructure can be difficult, when your architecture grows beyond one server and one service, how do you keep your infrastructure as neat and tidy as your code? In this session, Guy will introduce the audience to Terraform, an open source tool that helps you safely and predictably create, change and remove infrastructure and to collaborate, edit and version it just like another part of your codebase.

Later, we will show examples using Terraform to set up our cloud infrastructure on GCP and how to connect it to other cloud services such as Cloudflare and New Relic all from a single interface.

About Guy Mailar

Software Architect at Tailor Brands, a VC backed branding platform startup that helps small businesses around the globe create logos, ads, social media marketing content that raised $20MM to date. Guy formerly worked with StreamElements and eRated as software engineer and interim CTO.

Join us on March 18th at Google Israel, Electra Tower, 98 Yigal Alon St. Tel-Aviv, 12th floor
